discussion.p: According to SG1 experts, the requirement in [atomics.lockfree]/2 is intended to require that the answer for is_lock_free() be the same for a given T for a given run of the program. The wording does not achieve that because it's described in terms of 'pointers', but there are no pointers in an atomic<int>.
discussion.note: 2020-02 Status to Ready on Thursday morning in Prague.
2020-11-09 Approved In November virtual meeting. Status changed: Ready → WP.

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4830.

blockquote.p: -2- The functions atomic<T>::is_lock_free, and atomic_is_lock_free () indicates whether the object is lock-free. In any given program execution, the result of the lock-free query is the same for all atomic objects shall be consistent for all pointers of the same type.
